subject: Mental Health
title: Therapy Approaches for Youth
description: One-minute skill: Therapy Approaches for Youth.

hook.text: You can't just shrink adult therapy and give it to children. Developing brains need different tools.

buildup.text: Play therapy, art therapy, and adapted CBT are designed for developing minds.

discovery.text: CBT adapted for children uses games, stories, and role-play to teach coping skills.

twist.text: Including parents in therapy doubles the effectiveness for most childhood conditions.

climax.text: Telehealth has expanded access, especially for rural and underserved youth.

punchline.text: The best therapy meets children where they are â€” not where adults think they should be.

quiz.question: What makes child therapy more effective?
options: Including parents in the therapeutic process
